meanings.definition: Having or showing keen insight or understanding.
meanings.sent1: She is very perceptive and always notices small details.
meanings.sent2: The perceptive student quickly grasped the concept.
meanings.sent3: The perceptive detective solved the case in record time.
meanings.sent4: Her perceptive eyes scanned the room, taking in every detail.
meanings.sent5: His perceptive nature made him an excellent judge of character.

meanings.definition: Able to perceive or understand quickly and accurately.
meanings.sent1: The perceptive child could see things others missed.
meanings.sent2: Being perceptive helped her navigate social situations with ease.
meanings.sent3: The perceptive cat always knew when it was time for treats.
meanings.sent4: His perceptive mind was like a finely tuned instrument.
meanings.sent5: The perceptive scientist made groundbreaking discoveries in her field.
